items.prompt: What does 'Job Title' mean on a business card?
items.explanation: 'Job Title' refers to the specific position a person holds (e.g., Accountant, Manager).

items.prompt: Which term refers to your 'empresa' in English?
items.explanation: 'Company' is the standard word for enterprise or firm.

items.prompt: On a business card, what is 'ext.' followed by numbers?
items.explanation: 'Ext.' stands for extension, a shorter number used inside a company's phone system.

items.prompt: What information is usually found under 'Contact Details'?
items.explanation: Contact details include ways to reach the person professionally.

items.prompt: Choose the correct phrase to confirm someone's job:
items.explanation: We use 'You are...' or 'Are you...?' for professions.

items.prompt: In a business card, what does 'HQ' stand for?
items.explanation: 'HQ' stands for headquarters, the main administrative center of an organization.

items.prompt: If a card says 'Marketing Department', what is 'Department'?
options: A specific division within a company
items.explanation: A department is a specialized section of a large organization.

items.prompt: Which of these is a job title?
items.explanation: Receptionist is a professional role.

items.prompt: What is the English term for 'Nombre completo'?
items.explanation: 'Full name' includes your first and last names.

items.prompt: A: 'Where is your office ______?' B: 'In Madrid.'
items.explanation: 'Located' is used to ask for the position or address of an office.

items.prompt: Which abbreviation is used for 'Mobile phone' on a card?
items.explanation: 'Mob.' is the standard abbreviation for mobile.

items.prompt: What does 'CEO' mean?
items.explanation: CEO is the highest-ranking person in a company.

items.prompt: If you see 'www.focusonenglish.com' on a card, what is it?
items.explanation: The 'www' indicates a website URL.

items.prompt: What is 'Zip Code' or 'Postcode'?
items.explanation: A zip code or postcode identifies a specific delivery area.

items.prompt: How do you ask for someone's company name?
options: What is the name of your company?
items.explanation: This is the most standard and professional way to ask.

items.prompt: Which of these is NOT usually on a business card?
items.explanation: Business cards only contain professional information.

items.prompt: What is the meaning of 'Personnel'?
items.explanation: Personnel refers to the people employed in an organization.

items.prompt: Which section of a card has the physical location?
items.explanation: The address section tells you where the office is.

items.prompt: A: 'Is this your work email?' B: 'Yes, ______.'
items.explanation: We use 'it' to refer back to 'email'.

items.prompt: Which job title is usually in the 'Accounts' department?
items.explanation: Accountants handle the financial records of a company.

items.text: A business card usually has a company [logo] (logotipo).
items.explanation: Logo is the graphical symbol of a brand.

items.text: Complete the phrase: My [job] [title] is Marketing Manager.
items.explanation: Job title is your professional position.

items.text: The main office of a company is the [headquarters].
items.explanation: Headquarters (or HQ) is the main office.

items.text:
A: Where is your company [located]?
B: It is in New York.
items.explanation: 'Located' asks for the place.

items.text: The abbreviation 'Tel.' stands for [Telephone].
items.explanation: Tel. is short for Telephone.

items.text:
A: What is your [full] name?
B: It's Robert Smith (both names).
items.explanation: Full name includes first and last names.

items.text: I work in the Human [Resources] department (HR).
items.explanation: HR stands for Human Resources.

items.text: The company name is 'Tech Solutions'. Tech is short for [Technology].
items.explanation: Tech is a common abbreviation for Technology.

items.text:
A: Is this your work [phone]?
B: Yes, it is 555-0199.
items.explanation: Phone refers to the contact number.

items.text: The [website] (página web) is www.myweb.com.
items.explanation: Website is the internet page.

items.prompt: Match the business card term with its Spanish translation:
items.explanation: Basic business card vocabulary.

items.prompt: Match the abbreviations with their full words:
items.explanation: Common abbreviations in contact data.

items.prompt: Match the department with the activity:
items.explanation: Standard company divisions.

items.prompt: Match the professional roles with their typical tasks:
items.explanation: Job responsibilities.

items.prompt: Match the contact info part with an example:
items.explanation: Examples of contact data types.

items.prompt: Match the question with the info type:
items.explanation: Questions and the information they seek.

items.prompt: Match the address parts:
items.explanation: Structure of a physical address.

items.prompt: Match the business terms:
items.explanation: Synonyms or related office terms.

items.prompt: Match the action with the card exchange:
items.explanation: Social interactions with business cards.

items.prompt: Match the email parts (Review):
items.explanation: Review of symbols from week 09.

items.prompt: A: 'Are you the Marketing Director?' B: 'No, I am the ______.'
items.explanation: Assistant is a logical alternative job title.

items.prompt: Where is the company logo usually located?
options: In the middle or at the top
At the bottom of the email
items.explanation: The logo is prominently displayed on the card.

items.prompt: If you see '+34' before a phone number, it is:
items.explanation: Country codes are used for international calls.

items.prompt: Which of these is a correct email format?
items.explanation: Standard email structure.

items.prompt: What does 'Inc.' mean after a company name?
items.explanation: Inc. means the company is a legal corporation.

items.prompt: How do you pronounce 'Ltd.'?
items.explanation: Ltd. is the abbreviation for Limited (company).

items.prompt: A: 'Do you work for Global Tech?' B: 'Yes, ______.'
items.explanation: Short answer for 'Do you...' is 'Yes, I do'.

items.prompt: Which job title works with computers and networks?
items.explanation: IT (Information Technology) Support handles technical issues.

items.prompt: What is the 'Footer' of an email?
options: The top part with the subject
The bottom part with contact info
items.explanation: The footer contains the professional signature and contact data.

items.prompt: A: 'What is your ______ name?' B: 'It's John.'
items.explanation: First name is your given name.

items.text: Complete: I am a Sales [Representative] (vendedor).
items.explanation: Sales Representative is a common job title.

items.text: The abbreviation for Human Resources is [HR].
items.explanation: HR is the standard abbreviation.

items.text: The symbol '@' in an email is pronounced [at].
items.explanation: Review of pronunciation.

items.text: Please give me your [business] card (tarjeta de visita).
items.explanation: A business card is used for professional networking.

items.text:
A: What is your [profession]?
B: I am an Accountant.
items.explanation: Profession or job title are both possible.

items.text:
GLOBAL LOGISTICS
Mark Evans
Operations Manager
15 Bridge Street, Manchester
Tel: +44 161 998 0000

vocabulary.definition: A structure carrying a road over an obstacle

questions.prompt: What is the name of the company?

items.explanation: Extracting information from a professional business card.

items.text:
Best regards,
Laura Chen
Senior Designer | Creative Studio
laura.c@creativestudio.com

vocabulary.definition: A professional way to end an email

items.explanation: Analyzing an email signature for contact and role information.

items.text: Meeting at HQ on Friday.
items.explanation: Understanding common office abbreviations.

items.text: Profile: Name: Sofia Rossi. Company: Rossi & Co. Job: Accountant.
items.explanation: Inferred ownership through company naming conventions.
Identifying specific components of a phone number listing.

items.text:
Business Card:
Name: John Doe
Title: Sales Rep
items.explanation: Interpreting job titles and their levels.

items.prompt: What does 'Corp.' stand for?
items.explanation: Corp. is short for Corporation.

items.prompt: Which of these is a 'Surname'?
items.explanation: Johnson is a last name or surname.

items.prompt: How do you ask for a postcode?
items.explanation: Standard way to ask for information.

items.prompt: What is 'Personal Assistant' abbreviated to?
items.explanation: PA is the standard abbreviation.

items.prompt: If a card says 'Reception', what is it?
items.explanation: Reception is the area where visitors arrive.

items.prompt: Which abbreviation is used for 'Avenue' in an address?
items.explanation: Av. and Ave. are both very common abbreviations for Avenue.

items.prompt: A: 'Here is my business card.' B: '______.'
items.explanation: The polite response to receiving a card is 'Thank you'.

items.prompt: What is the 'Area Code' in a phone number?
items.explanation: The area code identifies the geographical region of the phone number.

items.prompt: A: 'Do you have a card?' B: 'No, I'm ______, I don't.'
items.explanation: We use 'I'm sorry' to politely decline a request.

items.prompt: Which of these is a 'Contact Detail'?
items.explanation: Address is a standard contact detail on a business card.

items.prompt: What does 'Dir.' usually mean in a job title?
items.explanation: Dir. is short for Director.

items.title: Exchanging Business Cards
items.transcript: A: Nice to meet you, Mrs. Smith. Here is my business card. B: Thank you. Let me give you mine too. A: Oh, you are the Marketing Director at Global Tech? B: Yes, that's right.

questions.question: What is the woman's job title?
questions.explanation: The man says: 'you are the Marketing Director at Global Tech' and she confirms.

questions.question: Where does she work?
questions.explanation: The company name mentioned is Global Tech.

items.explanation: Listening for professional titles and company names in a social exchange.

items.title: Verifying Contact Info
items.transcript: A: Is this your mobile number on the card? B: Yes, it is. But the extension for the office is different now. It is extension 405. A: 4-0-5. Got it.

questions.question: What is the new office extension?
questions.explanation: The speaker says the new extension is 405.

items.explanation: Focusing on numerical information and updates to contact details.

items.title: The Wrong Email
items.transcript: A: Is your email 'john.d@tech.com'? B: No, it's 'john.doe@tech.com'. There is no dot between 'john' and 'd'. Wait, it's just 'john.doe'. No abbreviation.

questions.question: What is the correct email?
questions.explanation: He clarifies that his email uses his full last name: 'john.doe@tech.com'.

items.explanation: Identifying spelling and structure of email addresses in conversation.
